subject: Re: [junit] LOADER CONSTRAINTS VIOLATED
msgSnippet: ... so it is possible to find the answer by searching the archive... ... Thank you for volonteering :-) It is (IMHO) wrong to catch these errors. The goal of
messageBody:
> I follow this mailing list very closely and see this question a lot.


so it is possible to find the answer by searching the archive...

> Perhaps this issue has already been discussed in the developers' list but I
> think we need an explanation for why this problem has not (or can not) be
> fixed here as well. For instance, it seems to me that we could catch these
> errors instead of letting them fall through and stop the execution of the
> application.


Thank you for volonteering :-)

It is (IMHO) wrong to catch these errors. The goal of the application is
to run _all_ the tests, and not only those who could be successfully
loaded. The developer must know that some of his/her tests couldn't be
executed because of a linkage error.

-Vladimir
--
Vladimir Bossicard
